messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] force feeding
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/10/2003 5:03:19 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... I wasn t forced either, by my parents. But I had friends whose parents would make me eat
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/10/2003 5:03:19 PM Eastern Standard Time,
mummyone24@... writes:
> . I'm wondering about
> the people who do force their kids? What could possibly be the reason
> someone would force someone else to eat something they didn't like? Just
> seems so clear to me not to do it.

I wasn't forced either, by my parents. But I had friends whose parents would
make me eat certain things---and drink MILK------EEEEYEEEWW!

But I *was* a member of the "Clean Plate Club"---all those starving children
in China, ya' know!. I didn't have to eat anything I didn't care for--- but I
DID have to eat what was in front of me.

I babysat for people who force fed their children---and made ME an
accomplice! THAT'S when I decided I would never do it. I saw so many children
made to eat---and just chew and chew and chew, never swallowing. Suppertime
would last for HOURS! When Cameron was a baby I refused to get caught up in
that, just KNOWING that he would be a picky eater. WRONG! That child has
always eaten everything he's ever tried! Go figure! Whenever you're
prepared...! <G>

~Kelly



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
